name: year
text: Only the years weather_years are available (until we get a bigger hard-drive)

name: cf_exponent
full_name: Capacity factor exponent for spatial distribution of wind and solar
text: If exponent is 0 generators are distributed evenly across the region, if it is 1 they are distributed proportional to capacity factor, if it is x they are distributed proportional to (capacity factor)^x

name: location
text: Select from map above.

name: frequency
text: n-hourly, n<3 is very slow, big n solves faster (n=25 or n=49 give fast and relatively accurate results)

name: load
text: Demand should be large enough for utility-scale assets but small enough to neglect land availability constraints

name: allam_cycle_cost
full_name: Assume 2x costs of hydrogen_turbine based on [^mitchell2019], where CCGT is reported 556 gbp/kW, allam 1430 gbp with ASU and w/o ASU 1145.7 gbp, i.e. 2x as expensive as CCGT without the ASU costs.
text: [^mitchell2019]: Mitchell, C., Avagyan, V., Chalmers, H., & Lucquiaud, M. (2019). An initial assessment of the value of Allam Cycle power plants with liquid oxygen storage in future GB electricity system. International Journal of Greenhouse Gas Control, 87, 1–18. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijggc.2019.04.020

name: allam_cycle_fom
unit: percent of overnight cost per year
text: [^mitchell2019]: Mitchell, C., Avagyan, V., Chalmers, H., & Lucquiaud, M. (2019). An initial assessment of the value of Allam Cycle power plants with liquid oxygen storage in future GB electricity system. International Journal of Greenhouse Gas Control, 87, 1–18. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijggc.2019.04.020

name: allam_cycle_efficiency
text: [^mitchell2019]: Mitchell, C., Avagyan, V., Chalmers, H., & Lucquiaud, M. (2019). An initial assessment of the value of Allam Cycle power plants with liquid oxygen storage in future GB electricity system. International Journal of Greenhouse Gas Control, 87, 1–18. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijggc.2019.04.020

name: allam_cycle_o2
full_name: 5.54 MWh/t_MeOH (LHV); 1.5 t_O2/t_MeOH required when assuming perfect combustion: 2 CH3OH + 2 O2 -> 2 CO2 + 4 H2O, with molar weight of CH3OH and O2 being identical, i.e. 1.5x the amount of MeOH is required as O2.
text: calculated.

name: allam_cycle_co2_capture_efficiency
text: [^mitchell2019]: Mitchell, C., Avagyan, V., Chalmers, H., & Lucquiaud, M. (2019). An initial assessment of the value of Allam Cycle power plants with liquid oxygen storage in future GB electricity system. International Journal of Greenhouse Gas Control, 87, 1–18. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijggc.2019.04.020

name: air_separation_unit_cost
full_name: 0.8 MEUR-2020/(t_CO2 output/h) = 1.1 MEUR-2020/(t_O2/h) from Excel 'Specific investment optional O2 plant (ASU)' of technology '402.a Oxy-fuel - Large Biomass', inflation adjusted with 2% p.a. from 2020 to 2015
text: Danish Energy Agency. (2021). Technology Data for Carbon Capture, Transport and Storage.

name: air_separation_unit_fom
unit: percent of overnight cost per year
full_name: Calculated from OF-CC plant: Fixed O&M (mill € /[t CO2 output/Hour]) of 0.033 / 1.45 Specific investment (mill € /[t CO2 output/hour]) = 3% / a) for technology "402.a Oxy-fuel - Large Biomass" in Excel
text: Danish Energy Agency. (2021). Technology Data for Carbon Capture, Transport and Storage.

name: air_separation_unit_lifetime
full_name: from Excel "technical lifetime" of the OF-CC plant of technology "402.a Oxy-fuel - Large Biomass"
text: Danish Energy Agency. (2021). Technology Data for Carbon Capture, Transport and Storage.

name: air_separation_unit_efficiency
full_name: from Excel "Electricity input for optional  O₂ plant (ASU)  (MW/ton CO₂/h)" 0.19 MWh_e / t_CO2 converted for O2 at molecular mass ratio 0.19/(8/11) = 0.26125 MWh_e/t_O2 ; of technology "402.a Oxy-fuel - Large Biomass", comparable but smaller than reported e.g. by [^mitchell2019] in table 7 of 1.164 MJ_e/kg_O2 = 0,323 MWh_e/t_O2 .
text: Danish Energy Agency. (2021). Technology Data for Carbon Capture, Transport and Storage.

name: oxygen_storage_liquefaction_efficiency
full_name: Additional electricity demand for oxygen liquefaction for ASU, from table 7: 0.933 MJ/kg O2 .
text: [^mitchell2019]: Mitchell, C., Avagyan, V., Chalmers, H., & Lucquiaud, M. (2019). An initial assessment of the value of Allam Cycle power plants with liquid oxygen storage in future GB electricity system. International Journal of Greenhouse Gas Control, 87, 1–18. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijggc.2019.04.020

name: oxygen_storage_cost
full_name: Estimate, based on a value from [^hu2013], which states 320 EUR-2012/m3 incl. installation but based on a single supply quote for 2500 m3 tank installation; 320 EUR/m3 / 1,142 t/m3_O2(l) * (1,03 inflation per year)^(3 years) = 306 EUR-2015/t_O2(l); to be on safe side, assume here 50 EUR more as buffer, i.e. 360 EUR-2015/t. [^hanak2017] also suggest a scaling factor of 0.6 which we neglect here, so value here might be significantly overestimating (3-4x) for large storage tanks >10kt O2 (l) storing capacity.
text: [^hanak2017]: Hanak, D. P., Powell, D., & Manovic, V. (2017). Techno-economic analysis of oxy-combustion coal-fired power plant with cryogenic oxygen storage. Applied Energy, 191, 193–203. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.apenergy.2017.01.049 , [^hu2013]: Hu, Y., Li, X., Li, H., & Yan, J. (2013). Peak and off-peak operations of the air separation unit in oxy-coal combustion power generation systems. Applied Energy, 112, 747–754. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.apenergy.2012.12.001

name: oxygen_storage_fom
unit: percent of overnight cost per year

name: oxygen_storage_standing_loss
full_name: Daily cryogenic evaporation losses from oxygen storage, suggested 0.05-0.1%/d by Teichgraeber, H., Brodrick, P. G., & Brandt, A. R. (2017). Optimal design and operations of a flexible oxyfuel natural gas plant. Energy, 141, 506–518. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.energy.2017.09.087

name: co2_storage_cost
full_name: Liquefied (cryo) CO2 storage tank capital cost (CAPEX), original source is 589 EUR-2019, adjusted with 2% inflation to 589/1.02^4=~545 EUR-2015/t_CO2.
text: Concave and Aramco (2022): E-Fuels: A techno-economic assessment of European domestic production and imports towards 2050 (Concawe Report 17/22), https://www.concawe.eu/publication/e-fuels-a-techno-economic-assessment-of-european-domestic-production-and-imports-towards-2050/ , table 82.

name: co2_liquefaction_cost
full_name: CO2 liquefaction for cryo CO2 storage for low pressure CO2 input stream (1-2 bar) to low pressure, liquid CO2 (5.5 to 9.8 bar, -55 to -41°C), CAPEX, original source lists 19.5 GBP-2017/(t_CO2/a), converted using 1 GBP:1.07 EUR exchange rate, inflation adjustment with 2%/p.a. to EUR-2015 and from t_CO2/a to t_CO2/h .
text: elementenergy (2018): Shipping CO2 - UK cost estimation study , https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/761762/BEIS_Shipping_CO2.pdf , table 3-1 and 4-2.

name: hydrogen_storage_cavern_compressor_cost
full_name: Hydrogen underground salt cavern storage compressor and above-ground facilities capital cost (overnight) for surfrace processing unit of 126MGBP with 1 GW_H2 i.e. 126 MGBP/1 GW_H2*1.08/1.02^3*2 where 1 GBP:1.08 EUR exchange rate and inflation adjustment for 3 years with 2%/a from 2018 to 2015 is done. Cost are doubled because low-input pressure for alkaline electrolysis requires two-stage compression scheme with double the amount of facilities
